summary: Request to versionize documentation and API reference for the TypeScript SDK so that users can access documentation matching their installed version, rather than always seeing the latest development version.
userImpact: Users cannot easily access documentation that matches the version of the SDK they are using, creating confusion when API differences exist between versions.
rootCause: Current documentation is always built from the main branch and deployed as a single version, not tied to released versions of the SDK.
proposedFix: Implement versioned documentation system where each release gets its own documentation version, potentially deployed from the release branch instead of main for API reference.
workaround: Users can build and view documentation locally by cloning the repository, checking out a specific version tag, and running the build process locally.
keyQuote: Relevant both for docs and API reference. And latest version of API ref could be deployed from `release` branch instead of `main`
